topics.title: Objects in JavaScript
topics.description: Understanding objects, properties, methods, this keyword, and object-oriented programming

contents.title: Introduction to Objects
contents.content:
Objects are collections of key-value pairs. They are the foundation of JavaScript and used to represent real-world entities.

Key Concepts:
â€¢ Properties: Data stored in objects (key-value pairs)
â€¢ Methods: Functions stored in objects
â€¢ this keyword: Refers to current object
â€¢ Prototypes: Inheritance mechanism
â€¢ Constructor functions: Create multiple objects
â€¢ Classes: Modern syntax for OOP

Object Characteristics:
â€¢ Unordered collection
â€¢ Keys are strings or symbols
â€¢ Values can be any type
â€¢ Mutable (can be changed)
â€¢ Passed by reference

When to Use Objects:
â€¢ Represent entities (user, product, etc.)
â€¢ Group related data
â€¢ Create structured data
â€¢ Implement OOP concepts
â€¢ Store configuration settings

contents.title: Creating and Using Objects

examples.title: this Keyword
examples.explanation: The 'this' keyword refers to the object that is executing the current function. It allows methods to access other properties of the same object.
